physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 4 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#442 Mann and Weinberger Families, 1900-46." On back of photograph: "Joe Mann, c 1943, #442(e), Founder of Shrine Hill Billy Band. Entertained troops at Army camps. Received citation from U.S. Govt. for selling over a million dollars in War Bonds."

mods.abstract: Joe Mann dressed as a hillbilly and playing the accordion. Mann was the founder of Shrine Hill Billy Band. The band entertained troops at Army camps and received citation from U.S. Govt. for selling over a million dollars in War Bonds."
mods.note: Donated by Mr. and Mrs. Schoen
